title: Estádio Figueira de Melo
text:
Estádio Ronaldo Luis Nazário de Lima, formerly known as Estádio Figueira de Melo or simply Figueirinha, is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> located in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>. Its primary use is as a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> venue and hosts the home matches of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Crist%C3%B3v%C3%A3o%20de%20Futebol%20e%20Regatas">São Cristóvão de Futebol e Regatas</a>. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 8,000 and was built in 1916. The stadium was originally named for the street on which it is located, Figueira de Melo Street, but in 2013 it was renamed to Estádio Ronaldo Luis Nazário de Lima, after the former footballer <a href="Ronaldo%20Naz%C3%A1rio">Ronaldo</a>, whose career started as a youth player for São Cristóvão.
History.
The first game was April 23, 1916, when São Cristóvão and <a href="Santos%20Futebol%20Clube">Santos</a> drew 1-1.
